intro: Dichrocephala gracilis, commonly known as the slender dichrocephala, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, upright stems and small, alternate leaves. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in clusters, making it visually distinct. Dichrocephala gracilis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
